questions.question: Our new house was a dump.                             Which sentence is a supporting detail?

choices.answer: I was not excited to move.
It was on a busy street.
My dad was excited to  work on it.
All of the windows and doors were         broken.

questions.question: I am afraid of the dark.                                        Choose a supporting detail.

choices.answer: When the sun goes down, it gets dark.
I imagine all sorts of scary things are   under my bed.
My sister likes being in the dark.
I sleep with my parents.

questions.question: Building a snowman is enjoyable.                    Choose a supporting detail.

choices.answer: I wear mittens when there's snow          outside.
I love snow days because that means    there's no school.
There were several snowmen on our      block.
I love making the large balls of snow      for the body.

questions.question: I was frantic when I lost my baby brother.     Choose a supporting detail.

choices.answer: I was in tears as I searched the entire     house.
I was watching television.
My baby brother can be a pain                 sometimes.
My baby brother's name is Samuel.

questions.question: The boy looked strange.  Choose a                  supporting detail.

choices.answer: He was wearing nice jeans.
He had a simple haircut.
He was sporting a pink, green, and             blue mohawk.
His suit was freshly pressed.

questions.question: The old man was so angry.  Which is not a     supporting detail?

choices.answer: He screamed at the top of his lungs.
He smiled kindly at the clerk.
He shook his fists in the air.
His face turned fire engine red.

questions.question: The program was well done.  Which detail    does not belong?

choices.answer: The musician played the piano                beautifully.
The decorations on the set were             stunning.
No one could remember their lines.
The acting was superb.

questions.question: My teacher is kind. Choose the detail that     doesn't go.

choices.answer: He yells at us for everything.
He always helps when we don't               understand.
He tutors in the mornings and after        school.
He is very encouraging.

questions.question: My best friend and I are so much alike.          Which detail does not belong?

choices.answer: We always laugh at the same corny        jokes.
We both love romantic comedies.
She loves peanut butter as much as I     do.
We don't have anything in common.

questions.question: The food in the cafeteria was delicious.          Choose the detail that does not belong.

choices.answer: They served spaghetti and meatballs.
I wanted to go back for seconds.
It tasted like a big pile of mush.
It tasted just like my grandma's               spaghetti.
